challenges.question: In regards to Angular, which statement is true?

answers.item: Angular uses TypeScript while AngularJS uses JavaScript. Both of which dominate the industry.
AngularJS was a thriving framework from 2010 to circa 2020. Angular has taken it's place as one of the most powerful, modern frontend frameworks.
AngularJS is about as popular as Vue.js according to a recent survey. Angular competes moreso with React.
If a company is seeking an AngularJS developer, they have a modern architecture. Such as a monolithic application.

challenges.question: What is the difference between SQL & NoSQL

answers.item: SQL databases do not adhere to a format and therefore each record can be different. NoSQL databases are table based.
SQL databases are relational while NoSQL databases are non-relational.
SQL databases are far more flexible while NoSQL databases are not nearly as scalable.
Both database styles work well with XML.

challenges.question: Which statement is true in regards to C#?

answers.item: C# and .NET are the same thing.
C# is often times compared to Python. Though the two have differences, they can be hailed as tools for similar applications.
C# has roots in the C family and will therefore be familiar to C, C++, Java, and JavaScript developers.
Answers two and three are correct.

challenges.question: How are tokens used today in web applications?

answers.item: Tokens are related to caching browser data. Enhancing users' experience;
Tokens are resources to help websites gather crucial information such as fingerprinting and location.
Tokens are used as a security protocol to ensure they're automatically signed out after a specified amount of time. Or when a user navigates away from the tab.
Tokens are often times obtained from an authorization server, enabling users to access resources otherwise restricted.
Device fingerprinting is illegal and very difficult to discern. In turn, many companies are able to get away with it.
Fingerprinting is when different technologies track us both on and offline. Regardless of preferences.
Device fingerprinting is when a website or app captures the hardware serial number or similar identifiable characteristics about a user.
Fingerprinting is used strictly for political and security reasons. It's unrelated to advertising or general web surfing.

challenges.question: What is cornerstone content in relation to SEO?

answers.item: Cornerstone content is the idea of creating rich, 3,000+ word blog posts on a regular basis. Portraying the page as being an expert resource.
Cornerstone content is the idea of creating one page that has lots of related topics. Then linking those topics back to the cornerstone page.
Cornerstone content is the idea of composing a page with numerous external links to the industry's most reputable resources.
Cornerstone content is the idea linking to as many internal pages as possible. This linking structure serves as a visual map of pages.
